Name: Stephen Lyle Tu
Title-Department: Assistant Professor of Electrical and Computer Engineering -Ming Hsieh Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering
Biography: Stephen Tu was a research scientist in the Google DeepMind robotics team from 2019 to 2023 . He earned his PhD in Electrical Engineering and Computer Sciences from the University of California, Berkeley in 2019 .
Research Summary: Stephen is broadly interested in building robust, intelligent systems which safely interact with and control their surrounding environment . His research has focused on learning from temporally correlated data, mitigating distribution shifts in imitation learning, leveraging generative models for feedback policies,

Name: Mitul Luhar
Title-Department: Henry Salvatori Early Career Chair and Associate Professor of Aerospace and Mechanical Engineering and Civil and Environmental Engineering-Aerospace and Mechanical Engineering
Biography: Mitul Luhar was appointed the inaugural holder of the Henry Salvatori Early Career Chair in 2020 . He earned his Ph.D. in Civil and Environmental Engineering from MIT in 2012 and B.A. and M.Eng.
Research Summary: Dr. Luhar's core research expertise is in fluid dynamics . His work addresses aerodynamic and hydrodynamic design, coastal protection, river restoration, and environmental science .
